intro: Jacobinia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plant is shrub-like, with woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at moderate elevations. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
